com.citytechinc.cq.component.annotations.widgets

Annotation Type NumberField


  • @Retention(value=CLASS)
@Target(value={FIELD,METHOD})
public @interface NumberField
    Represents a Widget of type CQ.Ext.form.NumberField in Classic UI Represents a Widget of type granite/ui/components/foundation/form/numberfield in Touch UI

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean allowDecimals
      Used for Classic UI only False to disallow decimal values
      boolean allowNegative
      False to prevent entering a negative sign In Touch UI, if no min is set, setting allowNegative to false will set min to 0.0.
      int decimalPrecision
      Used for Classic UI only The maximum precision to display after the decimal separator
      String decimalSeparator
      Character(s) to allow as the decimal separator
      String max
      Used for Touch UI Only Indicates the maximum allowed value in the field
      String min
      Used for Touch UI Only Indicates the minimum allowed value in the field
      double step
      Used for Touch UI Only Indicates the valid numeric increments for values in the field Defaults to 1 - NOTE setting this to anything other than 1 really does not work due to Javascripts floating point arithmetic limitations.

    • Element Detail

      • allowDecimals

        public abstract boolean allowDecimals
        Used for Classic UI only False to disallow decimal values
        Returns:
        boolean
        Default:
        true

      • allowNegative

        public abstract boolean allowNegative
        False to prevent entering a negative sign In Touch UI, if no min is set, setting allowNegative to false will set min to 0.0.
        Returns:
        boolean
        Default:
        true

      • decimalPrecision

        public abstract int decimalPrecision
        Used for Classic UI only The maximum precision to display after the decimal separator
        Returns:
        int
        Default:
        2

      • decimalSeparator

        public abstract String decimalSeparator
        Character(s) to allow as the decimal separator
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        "."

      • min

        public abstract String min
        Used for Touch UI Only Indicates the minimum allowed value in the field
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        ""

      • max

        public abstract String max
        Used for Touch UI Only Indicates the maximum allowed value in the field
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        ""

      • step

        public abstract double step
        Used for Touch UI Only Indicates the valid numeric increments for values in the field Defaults to 1 - NOTE setting this to anything other than 1 really does not work due to Javascripts floating point arithmetic limitations.
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        1.0
